H0.text: Algae break down and recycle dead organisms such as fish and plankton that sink to the bottom of the ocean in an ocean ecosystem.

H1.text: Bacteria break down and recycle dead organisms such as fish and plankton that sink to the bottom of the ocean.

H2.text: Mollusks are the organisms that break down and recycle dead fish and plankton that sink to the bottom of the ocean in an ecosystem.

H3.text: Sponges break down and recycle dead organisms such as fish and plankton that sink to the bottom of the ocean in an ocean ecosystem.

A4.text: Bacteria are responsible for the putrefaction stage in the decomposition of dead bodies.

A5.text: Bacteria play a vital role in many stages of the nutrient cycle by recycling nutrients and the fixation of nitrogen from the atmosphere.
